episode_title: 216 - The One Where Joey Moves Out
note: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Chandler and Joey are sitting at the bar, in their bathrobes, eating cereal]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man this is weird. You ever realize Captain Crunch’s eyebrows are actually on his hat?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s what’s weird? Joey, the man’s been captain of a cereal for the last 40 years.
[Joey finishes his cereal, licks his spoon, and puts it back in the silverware drawer.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Waaa-aaah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The spoon. You licked and-and you put. You licked and you put.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, so.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well don’t you see how gross that is? I mean that’s like you using my toothbrush. [Joey gets a sheepish look] You used my toothbrush?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, that was only ’cause I used the red one to unclog the drain.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mine is the red one! Oh God. Can open, worms everywhere.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, why can’t we use the same toothbrush, but we can use the same soap?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because soap is soap. It’s self-cleaning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, well next time you take a shower, think about the last thing I wash and the first thing you wash.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Phoebe are sitting at the table, Joey and Chandler enter.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica & Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, look at you fancy lads. What’s the occasion?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, you know that guy that’s on my show that’s in a coma? He’s havin’ a brunch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ahh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [enters from her room] OK, ready when you are.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okey-doke.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you guys are actually getting tattoos.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excuse me, you guys are getting tattoos?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, but you can not tell Ross ’cause I want to surprise him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, this is wild. What’re you gonna get?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, I’m getting a lily for my Mom. ’Cause her name’s Lily.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, that’s lucky. What if her name was Big Ugly Splotch?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So where you gettin’ it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think on my shoulder. [Ross enters]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? What’s on your shoulder?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, a chip. A tattoo, I’m getting a tattoo.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A tattoo? Why, why would you want to do that? [to Rachel] Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. Well hey, you don’t - you don’t think they’re kind of cool?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, sorry I don’t. Tell me why would anyone pay someone to scar their body for life? What if it doesn’t come out right Phoebe? Then it’s like, I don’t know, havin’ a bad hair cut all the time. Why’s everyone staring at me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, come sign this birthday card for dad. Rich is gonna be here any minute.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oooh, Rich is goin’ to the party too, huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, he’s my parents’ best friend, he has to be there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, is today the day you’re gonna tell them about you two?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. It’s my dad’s birthday, I decided to give him a stroke.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I think you should tell them.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I don’t even know how serious he is about me. Until I do, I’m not telling them anything.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, I don’t think mom and dad would mind. Remember when you were 9 and Richard was 30, how dad used to say, ‘God I hope they get together.’

content.description: The Gellers’ house. Monica, Ross, and Richard are arriving to Mr. Gellers birthday party.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, shall we?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, wait, wait, wait, wait. You know what? Ross, let’s - let’s switch places. You get in the middle. No un-, ya know, unless this looks like we’re trying to cover something up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica, Monica, you could come in straddling him, they still wouldn’t believe it. [opens door] We’re here.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh hi kids. Hi darling.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Happy birthday dad.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Oh thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi ma.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Happy birthday.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well, you kids thank Dr. Burke for the ride?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, actually mom, I think Monica thanked him for the both of us.

content.description: The Gellers’ kitchen. Monica, Mrs. Geller and one of Mrs. Geller’s friends are preparing the cake.

content.text: Friend: Well, you kids take the train in?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: No, Richard Burke gave them a ride.

content.speaker: Friend
content.text: Oh. Speaking of whom, I hear he’s got some 20-year-old twinkie in the city. [Monica sprays whipped cream all over the place]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Finger cramp. Oh God, sorry. Here, let me get that mom.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Sooo, Richard’s shopping in the junior section.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are we still on that?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: We just know she’s got the IQ of a napkin.

content.speaker: Friend
content.text: She’s probably not even very pretty, just young enough so that everything is still pointing up. [Monica folds her arms over her breasts]

content.description: Joey’s co-star’s apartment. Chandler and Joey are at the brunch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can you believe this place?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, this is a great apartment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, I was just in the bathroom, and there’s mirrors on both sides of you. So when you’re in there it’s like you’re peein’ with the Rockettes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, there’s my fantasy come true. No, seriously.

content.speaker: Joey’s Co-Star
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! We were just sayin’, great apartment man.

content.speaker: Joey’s Co-Star
content.text: Thanks. You want it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Joey’s Co-Star
content.text: Yeah, I’m movin’ to a bigger place. You should definitely take this one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, can you see me in a place like this?

content.speaker: Joey’s Co-Star
content.text: Why not? You hate park views and high ceilings? C’mon I’ll show you the kitchen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [being left behind] Oh that’s all right fellas, I saw a kitchen this morning - on TV. Stop talking. OK.

content.description: Mr. Geller’s party. Mr. Geller and a friend are questioning Richard while Ross observes.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: C’mon, tell us.

content.speaker: Friend
content.text: Yeah, is she really 20.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I am not telling you guys anything.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: C’mon Rich, it’s my birthday, let me live vicariously.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad, you really don’t want to do that.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Ahh, what’s a little mid-life crisis between friends?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Jack, would you let it go?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Look, I know what you’re going through. When I turned 50 I got the Porsche. You… you got your own little speedster.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Guys. Seriously, it is not like that.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Tell you what, maybe one of these weekends you can borrow the car and I cou…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad, I beg you not to finish that sentence.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: What? I’m kidding. You know I’d never let him touch the Porsche.

content.description: Tattoo parlor. Phoebe and Rachel are deciding on tattoos.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK Rach, which, which lily? This lily or that lily?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I like this lily. It’s more open, ya know, and that’s like my mom. She had a more open, giving spirit. Ooh, Foghorn Leghorn, ooh.

content.speaker: Tattoo Artist
content.text: Alright, blonde girl, you’re in room two, not so blonde girl, you’re with me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Here we go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [reluctantly] Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re not going?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? Is it - is this ’cause of what Ross said?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Well, yeah, maybe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t believe this. Is this how this relationship’s gonna work? Ross equals boss. I mean, c’mon what is this, 1922?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s 1922?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just, you know, long time ago. Well, when men used to tell women what to do - a lot. And then there was suffrage, which is a good thing but is sounds horrible. Do you want to get this tattoo?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes I do, it’s just that Ross is…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, hey, HEY. Is your boyfriend the boss of you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, who is the boss of you?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. You are the boss of you. Now you march your heinie in there and get that heart tattooed on your hip. GO !!

content.description: Mr. Geller’s birthday party. Monica is in the bathroom and Richard comes in.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: How ya doin’?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m a twinkie.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Really? I’m a hero.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, this is so hard.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah, I know. I hate it too. Look, maybe we should just tell them.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Maybe we should just tell your parents first.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: My parents are dead.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: God, you are so lucky. I mean, I mean… you know what I mean.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I know, I know. Just hang in there, OK. OK, I’ll go out first, alright.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: [walks out of the bathroom and runs into Mrs. Geller who is going to the bathroom] Judy, going to the bathroom , good for you.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Thank you Richard, I appreciate the support.
[Monica jumps in the shower. Right after Mrs. Geller enters the bathroom, Mr. Geller peeks his head in.]

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Honey. Honey, have you seen my Harmon Kilerbrew bat? Bob doesn’t believe I have one.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I have no idea. Did you know Richard has a twinkie in the city?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I know. He’s like a new man. It’s like a scene from Cocoon .

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I just never would have pictured Richard with a bimbo.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Apparently, he told Johnny Shapiro that she’s quite a girl. In fact, he told Johnny that he thinks he’s falling in love with her.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Really.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I tell you, I’ve never seen him this happy.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: So Jack, you ever think about trading me in for a younger model?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Of course not. With you it’s like I’ve got two 25-year-olds.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: [they start kissing] Oh Jack stop.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: C’mon, it’s my birthday.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Chandler and Joey are returning from their brunch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can we drop this? I am not interested in the guy’s apartment.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh please, I saw the way you were checking out his mouldings. You want it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why would I want another apartment, huh? I’ve already got an apartment that I love.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well it wouldn’t kill you to say it once in a while.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, you want the truth? I’m thinkin’ about it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m 28 years old, I’ve never lived alone, and I’m finally at a place where I’ve got enough money that I don’t need a roommate anymore.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Woah, woah, woah. I don’t need a roommate either, OK? I can afford to live here by myself. Ya know, I may have to bring in somebody once a week to lick the silverware.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’re you gettin’ so bent out of shape for, huh? It’s not like we agreed to live together forever. We’re not Bert and Ernie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, you know what? If this is the way you feel, then maybe you should take it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well that’s how I feel.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well then maybe you should take it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well then maybe I will.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine with me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great. Then you’ll be able to spend more quality time with your real friends, the spoons.

content.description: Mr. Geller’s birthday party. Mr. and Mrs. Geller enter looking particularly refreshed. Monica follows looking rather pale.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Who’s drink can I freshen?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Almost time for cake.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mon, Mon, are you OK?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You remember that video I found of mom and dad?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I just caught the live show.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Eww.

content.description: Mr. Geller’s birthday party. Monica and Richard are alone in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey there.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing, I just heard something nice about you.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Humm, really?
[Mrs. Geller and Ross both enter]

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Richard. Richard. Your son isn’t seeing anyone is he?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Uhh, not that I know of.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well, I was thinking, why doesn’t he give Monica a call?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: That - that’s an idea.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, actually, I’m already seeing someone.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: She never tells us anything. Ross, did you know Monica’s seeing someone?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mom, there are so many people in my life. Some of them are seeing people and some of them aren’t. Is that crystal?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: So, who’s the mystery man?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, uh, he’s a doctor.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: A real doctor?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, a doctor of meat. Of course he’s a real doctor. And he’s handsome, and he’s sweet, and know you’d like him. [she puts her arm around Richard]

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well that’s wonderful… I

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mom, it’s OK.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: It is Judy.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Jack. Could you come in here for a moment? NOW!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: [enters with his bat] Found it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll take that dad. [grabs the bat]

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: It seems your daughter and Richard are something of an item.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: That’s impossible, he’s got a twinkie in the city.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dad, I’m the twinkie.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: You’re the twinkie?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: She’s not a twinkie.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Al-alright, l-look you guys, this is the best relationship I’ve been in…

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh please, a relationship.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, a relationship. For your information I am crazy about this man.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Am I supposed to stand here and listen to this on my birthday?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dad, dad this is a good thing for me. Ya know, and you even said yourself, you’ve never seen Richard happier.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: When did I say that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Upstairs in the bathroom right before you felt up mom.
[Everyone else enters and all start singing Happy Birthday.]

content.description: Tattoo parlor. Rachel is showing Phoebe her tattoo.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that looks so good, oh I love it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, so do I. Oh Phoebe, I’m so glad you made me do this. OK, lemme se yours.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ahh. OK, let’s see yours again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe we just saw mine, let me see yours.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh OK. [pulls over her shirt and shows a bare shoulder] Oh no, oh it’s gone, that’s so weird, I don’t know how-where it went.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You didn’t get it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why didn’t you get it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, how would you do this to me? This was all your idea.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, I know, and I was gonna get it but then he came in with this needle and uh, di-, did you know they do this with needles?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? You don’t say, because mine was licked on by kittens.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Chandler is at the bar and Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey listen, I’m sorry about what happened…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah me too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know. Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. So do we need to hug here or…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, we’re alright.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So I got ya something. [tosses Joey a bag of plastic spoons]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Plastic spoons. Great.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Lick away my man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: These’ll go great in my new place. You know, ’till I get real ones.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I can’t use these forever. I mean, let’s face it, they’re no friend to the environment.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no, I mean what, what’s this about your new place?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m movin’ out like we talked about.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I didn’t think that was serious. [grabs the spoons back] Ya know I thought that was just a fight.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, it was a fight… based on serious stuff, remember. About how I never lived alone or anything. I just think it would be good for me, ya know, help me to grow or… whatever.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, there you go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, are you cool with this. I mean, I don’t want to leave you high and dry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, no, I’ve never been lower or wetter. I’ll be fine. I’ll just turn your, uh, bedroom into a game room or somethin’, you know, put the foosball table in there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Woah. Why do you get to keep the table?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I did pay for half of it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. And uh, I paid for the other half.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright I’ll tell you what, I’ll play you for it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, you’re on. I can take two minutes out of my day to kick your ass.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Your little men are gonna get scored on more times than your sister.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Woah, woah, woah, woah. Which sister?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Richard are setting the table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, are you sorry that I told them?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No, it’s been a long time since your dad and I went running.
[Rachel and Phoebe enter]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. Well did you get it? Let me see.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is Ross here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No he went out to get pizza.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh really, OK. [shows Monica her tattoo]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s great.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Very tasteful.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wanna see mine, wanna see mine?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? You didn’t get one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, well then what is this? [shows her bare shoulder]

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: What’re we looking at? That blue freckle?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, that’s my tattoo.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is not a tattoo, that is a nothing. I finally got her back in the chair, bairly touched her with a needle, she jumped up screaming, and that was it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, hi. For your information this is exactly what I wanted. This is a tattoo of the earth as seen from a great distance. It’s the way my mother sees me from heaven.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, what a load of crap. That is a dot. Your mother is up in heaven going, ‘Where the hell is my lily, you wuss?’ OK, Phoebe, that is not a tattoo, this is a tattoo. [she bends over and bears her tattoo right when Ross returns]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You got a tattoo?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Maybe. But just a little one. Phoebe got the whole world.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Lemme see. [looks]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well it’s really… sexy. I wouldn’t have thought it would be but… wow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, so uh, is it sore or can you do stuff?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I guess.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, save us some pizza. [they go off to Rachel’s room]

content.description: Chandler’s apartment. Chandler and Joey are playing foosball for the table.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get out of the corner. Pass it, pass it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stop talkin’ to your men. [Joey scores]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! And the table is mine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Congratulations. [Chandler leaves]

content.description: Chandler’s apartment. The whole gang is helping Joey pack.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you guys are still gonna come visit me, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, you got the big TV. We’ll be over there all the time… [Chandler gives him a look] except when we are here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know you’re just moving uptown but I’m really gonna miss you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, how can you not be accross the hall anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, who’s gonna eat all our food, and tie up our phone lines, and - is that my bra? What the hell you doin’ with my bra?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no-no, it’s uh, it’s not what you think. We uh, we used it to, you know, fling water balloons off the roof. Remember that, those junior high kids couldn’t even get theirs accross the street.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [quietly] Yeah, I remember.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, let’s bring the rest of these down to the truck.
[Everyone except Joey and Chandler leave.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, uhh, em, you want me to uh, give you a hand with the foosball table?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Naa, you keep it, you need the practice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, I guess this is it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, right, yeah, I guess so.
[Joey walks to the door. He stops, turns around.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, uh, I don’t know when I’m gonna see you again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m guessing uh, tonight at the coffee house.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right, yeah. OK. Um, take care.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.
[Joey walks out and after a few seconds comes back in and gives Chandler a big hug. He then leaves for good and Chandler is left alone in his apartment.]
